incur.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: if you incur a cost, debt, or a fine, you have to pay money because of something you have done
incur.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: If the council loses the appeal, it will incur all the legal costs.
the heavy losses incurred by airlines since September 11th
incur.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: if you incur something unpleasant, it happens to you because of something you have done
incur.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: She wondered what she’d done to incur his displeasure this time.
incur.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: if you incur a cost, a debt, or a fine, you do something that means that you lose money or have to pay money
incur.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: The foundry has been operating at less than 50% capacity and has incurred significant operating losses.
The costs incurred in planning each month run to several thousand dollars.
